_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Garelick Farms of Franklin uses anhydrous ammonia, an EHS, at its plant in Franklin, Massachusetts. During the last five years there have been no releases.

This is due impart to there accidental release prevention program and other safety measures that are all part of their ongoing everyday operations. Accidents are prevented by our being pro-active to safety regulations and practices. It is Garelick's policy to constantly re-examine our operations and improve emergency response and accident prevention programs. 

We prevent accidents by designing for safety. By having alarms and interlocks that provide multiple lines of safety; automatic shutdown devices for major equipment to reduce duration and quantity of an accidental release; fire protection; independent and redundant backup systems for critical safety processes to ensure reliability of safety systems; piping built and maintained per high-integrity piping design codes; quality assurance of critical equipment to ensure fabrication to design specifications. 

Maintenance of our plant is done 24 hours a day. Specially qualified personnel routinely inspect, test, and maintain all equipment, including valves, pumps, seals, and tanks to ensure proper operation and mechanical integrity. In addition to regular maintenance operations, preventative maintenance (PM) is in place with all of our critical equipment with designated schedules. 

We operate safely by our staff being trained in startup, shutdown, operation and maintenance of all equipment. Some maintenance activities require internal permitting to ensure work is done safely for protection of our employees, property, environment, and community. 

Our inventories are managed to minimize risk and to maintain minimum quantities consistent with manufacturing needs. Audits and inspections are done routinely. Appropriate regulatory permits are obtained and maintained. There are complete investigations of all accidents and incidents. 

Administrativ

e controls and standard operating procedures are used as passive mitigation programs. The Emergency Response Team is trained in emergency shutdown procedures, hazardous material response and rescue operations. Environmental personnel are to be alerted, we coordinate with the Franklin Fire Department, Police Department and Local Emergency Planning Committee. 

On going training of the Emergency Response Team is a high priority in maintaining the good safety record that we have. 

In addition to all the ammonia detector sensors and the alarm on the CPU, we have installed a visual alarm to show in the Lab area. 

Garelick is committed to compliance with regulatory requirements and close cooperation with local, state and federal agencies to prevent incidents and effectively respond if emergencies occur.
